38 Lane Thomas

Bio

Related

Stats

Historical

Biography

2022 (Redshirt Junior): Tied for second on the team in appearances, as he saw action in 21 games all in relief... Was one of five members of the pitching staff with a save…... Logged 26.1 innings, struck out 21, gave up 17 earned runs and walked 20... Made his season debut in Tulane’s first road series of the season at LA Tech (2/25) 1.1 innings of scoreless baseball… Had a season high 4.0 innings of work at LSU (3/15) collecting seven strikeouts while giving up only three hits… Had 11 scoreless outings and four hitless outings…tabbed a strikeout. In the final game of the season vs ECU (5/28)… Ended the season with a 5.88 ERA.

2021 (Redshirt Sophomore): Saw action in six games in his rookie season with the Green Wave... Each of his appearances came out of the bullpen... Made his Tulane debut at Troy (3/13) and picked up his first collegiate strikeout... Worked 2.0 innings against Grand Canyon (3/28) and struck out a pair... Logged 2.0 innings at Cincinnati (5/21) and totaled two strikeouts... Saw action in the American Athletic Conference Championship against USF (5/29) and picked up one strikeout.

Prior to Tulane: A Walker, Louisiana-native, Thomas comes to New Orleans after spending two years at Jones College…Posted a 9-2 record with a 3.01 ERA and a team-high 73 strikeouts in 13 starts as a freshman…Pitched seven innings to help Jones County to an 11-4 win over LSU Eunice…Previously, was a three-year letterwinner at Walker High School, playing pitcher, first base and designated hitter…Helped his team to three straight playoff appearances (2016, 2017, 2018)…Named to the First Team All-Parish in 2016, 2017 and 2018, to the First Team All-District in 2017 and 2018 and to the Second Team All-District in 2016…Was named the Livingston Parish Pitcher of the Year in 2018…Pitched a complete game in the Wildcats first-round playoff game in 2017 to win against the No. 6 seed, also drove in both of the runs to lead Walker to its first playoff win in eight years…Intends to major in sport management at Tulane.

LANE'S NOLA STORY
